extendedIngredients.name: campari
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds fresh Campari tomatoes (or other variety), halved

extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh Campari tomatoes (or other variety), halved

extendedIngredients.originalString: Small handful of fresh parsley (no more than 1/4 cup lightly packed)
extendedIngredients.originalName: Small of fresh parsley (no more than 1/4 cup lightly packed)

title: Quick Roasted Tomato Soup
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.In a medium bowl, toss the halved tomatoes with just enough olive oil to coat and season with salt and pepper. Place the tomato halves cut side down on a foil-lined, rimmed baking sheet.In the same bowl that you used for the tomatoes, toss the onion slices with a small amount of olive oil and a pinch of salt. Arrange in a single layer on the baking sheet, adjacent to but not overlapping the tomatoes. Add the garlic cloves (with the skin still on) to the baking sheet as well.Place the baking sheet in the center rack of the oven and roast the vegetables for 25 minutes. Check on the onions about half way through the cooking time and give them a stir if needed to help ensure even cooking.Once cooked, use a spatula to carefully transfer the roasted tomato halves and onion slices to the jar of a blender. Squeeze the garlic cloves from their papery peels into the blender, then pour all of the pan juices into the mix as well. Add a small handful of fresh parsley (a little basil would do well here, too) and blend until smooth. Taste and add additional salt and pepper according to your preference.Serve immediately with a generous topping of crumbled feta cheese and extra black pepper.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.In a medium bowl, toss the halved tomatoes with just enough olive oil to coat and season with salt and pepper.

Place the tomato halves cut side down on a foil-lined, rimmed baking sheet.In the same bowl that you used for the tomatoes, toss the onion slices with a small amount of olive oil and a pinch of salt. Arrange in a single layer on the baking sheet, adjacent to but not overlapping the tomatoes.
Add the garlic cloves (with the skin still on) to the baking sheet as well.

Place the baking sheet in the center rack of the oven and roast the vegetables for 25 minutes. Check on the onions about half way through the cooking time and give them a stir if needed to help ensure even cooking.Once cooked, use a spatula to carefully transfer the roasted tomato halves and onion slices to the jar of a blender. Squeeze the garlic cloves from their papery peels into the blender, then pour all of the pan juices into the mix as well.
Add a small handful of fresh parsley (a little basil would do well here, too) and blend until smooth. Taste and add additional salt and pepper according to your preference.
Serve immediately with a generous topping of crumbled feta cheese and extra black pepper.
